title: How we're tackling the NHS backlog

content.text: The NHS has cut 18-month waits for routine treatment by more than 91% – a significant reduction from the peak which saw almost 125,000 people waiting for treatment in 2021, despite industrial action and a challenging winter.
Cutting waiting lists is one of the government’s five key priorities, and we are delivering on our Elective Recovery Plan to tackle the Covid backlog, starting with the longest waits.
